intro: Macrochordion pinelianum, commonly known as the Pinel Island grass. It is a species of flowering plant in the grass family, Poaceae, characterized by its tufted growth habit and slender, wiry stems. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in spikelets, which are typically wind-pollinated. It is native to specific regions of South America, particularly the Andean foothills, where it thrives in moist, temperate climates. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
